newsitem.title: USA: Wells puts merger-related cuts at 10,800.
newsitem.headline: Wells puts merger-related cuts at 10,800.

text.p: Wells Fargo & Co. said Friday it will eliminate 10,800 jobs by the third quarter of 1997 following its $12 billion merger with First Interstate Bancorp, up from previous forecasts of 9,000.

In a Securities Exchange Commission filing in April when the merger was completed, Wells projected 7,200 layoffs by the end of 1996. But company officials at the time said job cuts would approach 9,000.
In a recent SEC filing, San Francisco-based Wells said 3,600 jobs would be cut by the third quarter of 1997 in addition to 7,200 forecast for 1996, bringing the total to 10,800.
"Wells expects to have less than 35,000 people by the end of the third quarter," a spokeswoman said.
Wells' stock rose 75 cents to $277.375 on the New York Stock Exchange in late trading.
